questions.answer: Managing cholesterol reduces stroke risk. Treatment includes statins if needed, healthy diet, exercise, weight control, and regular monitoring. Affects blood vessels. Statins reduce stroke. Diet helps. Important risk factor.

questions.question: Diabetes
questions.answer: Controlling diabetes prevents nerve damage and stroke. Treatment includes medications, diet, exercise, blood sugar monitoring, and preventing complications. Damages nerves and vessels. Good control essential. Multiple complications preventable.

questions.question: Obesity
questions.answer: Maintaining healthy weight reduces neurological risks. Treatment includes diet modifications, regular exercise, behavioral changes, sometimes medications or surgery, and gradual weight loss. Increases many risks. Weight loss beneficial. Requires lifestyle change.

questions.question: Vitamin-B12
questions.answer: B12 deficiency causes neuropathy and cognitive problems. Treatment includes supplements or injections, treating absorption problems, monitoring levels, dietary sources, and preventing deficiency. Common in elderly. Easily treated. Important for nerves. Regular screening helps.

questions.question: Vitamin-D
questions.answer: Vitamin D deficiency linked to cognitive and mood problems. Treatment includes supplements, sun exposure, dietary sources, monitoring levels, and correcting deficiency. Common deficiency. Easy to treat. Affects mood and cognition. Testing available.

questions.question: Omega-3
questions.answer: Omega-3 fatty acids support brain health. Treatment includes fish consumption, supplements if needed, plant sources like flax, anti-inflammatory effects, and moderate evidence. Healthy fats. Found in fish. Supplements available. Probably beneficial.

questions.question: Antioxidants
questions.answer: Antioxidants may protect brain from damage. Treatment includes diet rich in fruits and vegetables, colorful produce, supplements controversial, whole foods preferred, and realistic expectations. Protect cells. Best from food. Supplement evidence weak.

questions.question: Caffeine
questions.answer: Caffeine affects alertness and headaches. Treatment includes moderate use, limiting afternoon intake, avoiding excess, treating caffeine withdrawal headaches, and individual tolerance varies. Stimulant. Helps alertness. Withdrawal causes headaches. Moderation key.

questions.question: Helmet
questions.answer: Helmets prevent traumatic brain injury. Treatment includes wearing during risky activities, proper fit essential, replacing after impact, bicycle and motorcycle use, and teaching children. Primary prevention. Saves lives. Reduces disability. Always wear.

questions.question: Seatbelt
questions.answer: Seatbelts prevent brain injury in accidents. Treatment includes always wearing, proper positioning, child restraints appropriate for age, and teaching importance. Simple prevention. Saves lives. Legal requirement. Always buckle.

questions.question: Fall-Prevention

questions.question: Vaccination
questions.answer: Vaccines prevent infections affecting the brain. Treatment includes staying current with vaccines, meningitis vaccines for teens, flu shots reduce stroke risk, shingles vaccine, and following schedule. Prevents serious infections. Safe and effective. Important protection.

questions.question: Genetic-Testing
questions.answer: Genetic testing identifies inherited neurological conditions. Treatment includes testing for family history, genetic counseling, understanding implications, planning for future, and family screening. Identifies risk. Helps planning. Counseling essential. Complex decisions.

questions.question: Screening

questions.question: MRI
questions.answer: MRI scans brain structure in detail. Treatment includes no radiation used, claustrophobia common, loud noise, takes 30-60 minutes, and very detailed images. Best brain imaging. No radiation. Safe. Expensive.

questions.question: CT-Scan
questions.answer: CT scans brain quickly for emergencies. Treatment includes fast imaging, radiation exposure, good for bleeding and fractures, less detail than MRI, and widely available. Quick imaging. Good for emergencies. Uses radiation. Less detail.

questions.question: PET-Scan
questions.answer: PET scans show brain metabolism and function. Treatment includes radioactive tracer used, expensive, research tool often, detects Alzheimer's changes, and not routine. Functional imaging. Shows metabolism. Expensive. Research use.

questions.question: EMG

questions.question: Lumbar-Puncture

questions.question: Angiogram

questions.question: Ultrasound
questions.answer: Ultrasound checks carotid arteries for blockages. Treatment includes painless test, no radiation, detects narrowing, screening tool, and quick test. Sound waves. No radiation. Painless. Screens for stroke risk.

questions.question: Biopsy
questions.answer: Brain biopsy diagnoses tumor or infection type. Treatment includes small sample removed, surgery required, diagnostic test, risks present, and determines treatment plan. Gets tissue sample. Invasive. Diagnostic. Guides treatment.

questions.question: Neuropsychological
questions.answer: Neuropsychological testing assesses cognitive function. Treatment includes several hours of tests, evaluates memory and thinking, helps diagnosis, measures deficits, and guides rehabilitation. Tests cognition. Takes hours. Helpful diagnosis. Baseline measurement.

questions.question: Speech-Assessment
questions.answer: Speech assessment evaluates language and swallowing. Treatment includes testing by speech therapist, assessing communication, swallowing evaluation, guiding therapy, and measuring progress. Evaluates communication. Tests swallowing. Guides treatment. Measures improvement.

questions.question: Physical-Assessment

questions.question: Occupational-Assessment

Treatment includes testing by occupational therapist, assessing self-care and work abilities, guiding therapy, recommending adaptations, and measuring independence. Evaluates daily skills. Guides therapy. Recommends aids. Tracks independence.

questions.question: Driving-Assessment
questions.answer: Driving assessment evaluates ability to drive safely. Treatment includes comprehensive testing, on-road evaluation, recommendations for modifications or restrictions, safety priority, and periodic reassessment. Safety evaluation. Comprehensive. Difficult conversations. Important assessment.

questions.question: Capacity-Assessment
questions.answer: Capacity assessment evaluates decision-making ability. Treatment includes formal evaluation, assessing understanding and reasoning, legal implications, protecting rights, and specific to decisions. Legal evaluation. Complex assessment. Protects rights. Situation-specific.

questions.question: Accommodations

Treatment includes requesting modifications, documentation needed, Americans with Disabilities Act protections, reasonable adjustments, and maintaining employment or education. Legal protections. Workplace modifications. School adjustments. Rights protected.

questions.answer: Assistive devices improve independence. Treatment includes canes, walkers, wheelchairs, communication devices, proper fitting and training, and insurance coverage. Improve function. Many types. Proper fitting. Increase independence.

questions.question: Quality-of-Life
questions.answer: Quality of life focuses on wellbeing not just survival. Treatment includes addressing symptoms, maintaining function, emotional support, social connections, meaningful activities, and patient priorities. Beyond survival. Subjective measure. Patient-defined. Treatment goal.
